response.answer_text: Not the disease itself - that’s nothing, but the mentality of the people manipulating you about it. Leaders are ruthless and War is the most profitable of all activities so by frightening the population they will cause it. Only a proper democracy where the leaders are controlled by the society could save us. I wrote this recently concerning coronavirus. "I am suspicious about potential exaggeration of the Coronavirus crisis as I notice a particular thing is happening, namely that we are being fed data rather than information. The effect is excitation because with data there is neither context nor comparison and dimensional testimony that information provides. If information, rather than data, was the basis of interchange we might expect a report like this. "Since December 2019 the World Health Organisation has been aware of the outbreak and spread of a disease called Coronavirus. So far the disease is said to have been contracted by 823,000 people in all being 0.01% of the World Population. It is worth noting that of those 600,000 current sufferers 95% are considered to be in mild condition and only 5% Serious or Critical. There seems to be no real understanding of how the infection is spread because there isn't much evidence that those countries in lockdown are in a better position than those which are not. For instance Italy and Spain are at 40 times the Global Average, France 10, Iran 7, Sweden 4, US 2, but Turkey below just as a simple example. The worst affected country is Italy where over the past 2 months there have been12,428 deaths. This equates to a death rate of 206 per million or 0.02% annualising at 0.12% provided the number of sufferers increases for the coming 10 months which we sincerely hope it does not and shouldn't do because Flu is normally associated with colder weather. We should bear in mind - for context and comparison - that 25,000 people died in the 2016/17 Flu Epidemic in Italy as part of what was then thought of as the normal and unavoidable periodic mutation and cycling of flu strains. This paper takes serious issue with World Governments, all but one of whose societies are - so far - less affected than Italy to make sure that a disease of this kind and at this stage of its progression be watched carefully and the sufferers taken care of, but the safety of those within vulnerable and marginal society groups not be endangered by economic collapse and dislocation of services which would seem to be an unavoidable consequence of the chosen method for defeating the illness. We have no idea where socio-economic trauma might lead us, but mass unemployment would cause misery and considerable shortening of lives and possibly many deaths depending on the remaining cohesiveness of the society, so people who wish to and consent must be allowed to go about their normal lives. By the contextual and level-headed standards of the rules of logic and reason a disease such as this should not lead to the extremeness of reaction we are witnessing. We would like the Government to inform us of their studies, particularly as to how many members of society they are willing to see harmed or killed in order to continue this campaigm to its conclusion?""
